title: The Emmy Red Carpet Photos
text:
You can also get a note like this in newsletter form. Sign up for Wait — here.

Below are all the pictures from last night’s red carpet at the Emmys. People (well, mostly women- people !) did a good job!

The Emmys were thrilling in a couple of ways. There’s nothing more charming than to see Phoebe Waller-Bridge take “Fleabag” from a piece of performance art and turn it into a ragingly good TV show and then win a bunch of awards.

And Billy Porter’s win for best lead actor in a drama series had a notable moment in his speech: He thanked “Bill Butler, my manager of 29 years. Twenty-nine years!” Success doesn’t happen overnight for all of us, so get up and keep at it, friends. (Or, I guess, you could also take a few days off, since it’s a long haul?)

Here’s who won. Here’s context. Here’s the notable fashion. And here’s our slide show.

What was not thrilling about the Emmys, honestly, was the horrible perforated goldenrod backdrop that some deathly committee of people chose for celebrity entrances. Picture a thousand photographers with their eyes bleed-crying!
description: Here’s the best of last night’s red carpet.
